body:
Renewable Power Project Finance










SOX-101 for Electric, Gas & Water Utilities..An 
		Introduction to Sarbanes-Oxley
APRIL 19-20, 2007  - Chicago, IL
 Click
        Here To Download A Complete Conference Brochure
 










Overview  
 This in-depth 
course is designed for those in a position to be directly impacted by the 
Sarbanes-Oxley Act, 2002, to include
SAS-70 Reporting requirements, for investor owned and municipal 
utilities...electric, gas & water. It opens with a detailed review of the 
current SOX compliance environment and what has guided it to this point, 
extensive workshops to learn compliance methodologies, and concludes with 
insight into future direction of the initiative. The seminar uses several 
approaches to elicit participation from attendees including individual and group 
exercises for recognizing, creating and documenting internal controls and a case 
study to simulate experiential learning. All participants are encouraged to ask 
questions and discuss issues of special interest to them. Extensive and 
comprehensive course notes are provided to each
attendee.


Register today!

Who 
		Should Attend:
 New members of a 
SOX environment will learn how to be productive immediately and experienced SOX 
personnel will hone
and focus their skills from the following business categories...

• Managers and Supervisors in Finance, Accounting, Operations and IT personnel
• Internal Audit Personnel ? IT and Finance
• Department Managers impacted by compliance efforts
• Service Providers to the various Utility industries (Electric, Gas & Water), 
such as Accountants, external IT services,
Customer Service outsourcing providers


What Attendees Will Learn
 This intensive 
one and a half day course will provide participants with a solid understanding 
of the basic components of internal controls, terms, issues, and methods of 
documentation necessary to be successful in the audit of compliant internal 
controls. Attendees will learn the following:

• How to...solve short-term compliance problems by improving your current 
business processes, rather than adding further overhead. (Get a return on your 
investment)
• How to...work with your executive team, including your internal and external 
advisors, to ensure continuity. (No need to replace any trusted advisors)
• How to...improve efficiency by using a risk-based approach to controls and 
audits (Positions your company for improvement opportunities and Enterprise Risk 
Management, not just compliance)
• How to...create and maintain internal controls through a better understanding 
of the components (Who, what, where, when & why)
• How to...identify and document the part IT controls play in the overall 
control framework




Topics Include:

The History And Future Of Sarbanes-Oxley For Utility Industries
Common SOX Practices in a Utility Enterprise
Focus on IT Controls in a Utility Business
Focus on Internal Controls for Utilities
Risk Assessment Approach to Internal Controls in a Utility
Project Planning Process Improvement - Every Utility Needs It!
Bringing it all Together in Your Utility

About The Instructors:
 
Mr. Russell "Buddy" Wimberley - Partner, Visage Solutions, LLC
Mr. Wimberley has a diversified operational management background in the utility 
industry, with hand-on experience in transforming evolving business problems 
into cost effective technology based solutions concentrating on emerging 
technologies and business solutions for electric, gas and water utilities. He 
has broad experience in regulated business unit Asset Management, T&D Planning 
and budgeting, retail access, customer choice, customer information systems, and 
commercial/industrial wholesale power customer billing systems.

As a Partner in Visage Solutions, a Sarbanes-Oxley compliance methodology 
solutions provider he has worked with associates in launching the products and 
services of the business. For one of the "Big-Four", served as a member of an 
issue resolution team to perform Information Technology Testing of Internal 
Controls for Sarbanes Oxley §404 Compliance for a multinational client company 
with three major business units and twenty-seven data centers. Mr. Wimberley as 
a member of a SAS-70 Training Team conducted extensive SAS-70 workshops for 
distributor members of the TVPPA.

Mr. Richard M. Owen, PMP, MBA - Executive Consultant, Visage 
Solutions, LLC
Mr. Owen has 25 years leadership experience in compliance, ethical business 
practices and project management in multiple
industries. He continues to provide keynote-speaking engagements on business 
process improvement, management techniques, project management effectiveness and 
motivation. Richard is an Adjunct Professor at the University of Houston, Bauer 
College of Business and Ph.D. Candidate in Leadership Ethics at Our Lady of the 
Lake University in San Antonio, Texas.
 For one of the largest global oil companies, Mr. Owen served as a team lead to 
		  perform Walkthrough Documentation, Process Mapping, Design and Testing of 
		  Internal Controls of business functions for Sarbanes Oxley §404 Compliance. As a 
		  member of a SAS-70 Training Team Mr. Owen has conducted extensive SAS-70 
		  workshops for distributor members of the TVPPA and currently is the Team Lead 
		  for the Law, Ethics & Compliance Chapter in the Guide to the Sarbanes-Oxley Body 
		  of Knowledge (SOXBoK) as commissioned by the SOX Institute.
